node.title: It's been 50 years since the infamous Attica prison riot
node.description: Inmates held some 36 hostages for five days. And that was just the beginning
node.content: ["For five days in 1971, more than 1,200 inmates took over a massive prison in New York state. The uprising spark nationwide news coverage, exposed troubling inequities in the U.S. prison system; and cost at least 43 lives.", "The event would spur public hearings, state investigations and street protests. It would also leave such a scar in U.S. history that its remnants would become literal museum pieces.", "Here's a look, in pictures, of the key players and what happened, both during the riot and after."]
